psalm.title: Book of Isaiah
psalm.text:
[[Is 12,2]]God indeed is my savior; 
I am confident and unafraid. 
My strength and my courage is the LORD, 
and he has been my savior.

[[Is 12,3]]With joy you will draw water 
at the fountain of salvation.
[[Is 12,4b]]Give thanks to the LORD, acclaim his name;
[[Is 12,4c]]among the nations make known his deeds,
[[Is 12,4d]]proclaim how exalted is his name.

[[Is 12,5]]Sing praise to the LORD for his glorious achievement; 
let this be known throughout all the earth.
[[Is 12,6]]Shout with exultation, O city of Zion, 
for great in your midst 
is the Holy One of Israel!

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 3,10]]And the crowds asked John the Baptist, "What then should we do?"
[[Lc 3,11]]He said to them in reply, "Whoever has two cloaks should share with the person who has none. And whoever has food should do likewise."
[[Lc 3,12]]Even tax collectors came to be baptized and they said to him, "Teacher, what should we do?"
[[Lc 3,13]]He answered them, "Stop collecting more than what is prescribed."
[[Lc 3,14]]Soldiers also asked him, "And what is it that we should do?" He told them, "Do not practice extortion, do not falsely accuse anyone, and be satisfied with your wages."
[[Lc 3,15]]Now the people were filled with expectation, and all were asking in their hearts whether John might be the Messiah.
[[Lc 3,16]]John answered them all, saying, "I am baptizing you with water, but one mightier than I is coming. I am not worthy to loosen the thongs of his sandals. He will baptize you with the holy Spirit and fire.
[[Lc 3,17]]His winnowing fan is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire."
[[Lc 3,18]]Exhorting them in many other ways, he preached good news to the people.

second_reading.title: Letter to the Philippians
second_reading.text:
[[Ph 4,4]]Brothers and sisters: Rejoice in the Lord always. I shall say it again: rejoice!
[[Ph 4,5]]Your kindness should be known to all. The Lord is near.
[[Ph 4,6]]Have no anxiety at all, but in everything, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, make your requests known to God.
[[Ph 4,7]]Then the peace of God that surpasses all understanding will guard your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.

first_reading.title: Book of Zephaniah
first_reading.text:
[[So 3,14]]Shout for joy, O daughter Zion! sing joyfully, O Israel! Be glad and exult with all your heart, O daughter Jerusalem!
[[So 3,15]]The LORD has removed the judgment against you, he has turned away your enemies; The King of Israel, the LORD, is in your midst, you have no further misfortune to fear.
[[So 3,16]]On that day, it shall be said to Jerusalem: Fear not, O Zion, be not discouraged!
[[So 3,17]]The LORD, your God, is in your midst, a mighty savior; He will rejoice over you with gladness, and renew you in his love, He will sing joyfully because of you,
[[So 3,18a]]as one sings at festivals.
